p: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) are one of the most widely used medications for the management of knee pain in patients with osteoarthritis of the knee [ 8]. The efficacy of oral NSAIDs, diclofenac in particular, for symptomatic relief of knee osteoarthritis has been well established in the literature [ 9]. Thanks to their good analgesic and antiphlogistic effects, NSAIDs are recommended by several international and national guidelines as the initial oral medication of choice in the treatment of symptomatic osteoarthritis of the knee with moderate-to-severe pain intensity [ 10, 11]. Several NSAIDs, including oral diclofenac, are available as over-the-counter medications in many countries, so the use of this drug is particularly widespread [ 12, 13].
